page.title: 06Interviews in Painswick
page.content: From interviews with a small sample of people in the streets of Painswick ,it was clear that it is a pleasant place to live.All spoke of the peacefull , quiet and friendly nature of the village.While it offers several ammenities ,it is not too big and the old stone houses with pretty gardens are very attractive.It has several times won the Bledisloe Cup for the best kept large village. The only complaint among residents seem to be about the roads.They feel there are not enough buses and there is too much heavy traffic through the centre ,in view of the narrow roads. A controversey at the moment is about a proposed three storey building development ,which some people feel would not be in keeping with the nature of the village.
